one: ^It is so wonderful for you to visit your dear old granny after so long. And it couldn’t have been at a better time.
^I've been sitting here staring at this confounded machine for hours. I just can't seem to make heads or tails of it.
^My dear sweety, could you help your dear granny with a few things, this contraption has me all tangled up.
^I have managed to just get by but with your help, perhaps you can teach me more.
^Your grandfather was always more of the techy one than I.
^To start off, the music is too soft. Me and my old ears cannot hear as well as I used to.
two: ^Oh, how wonderful! I can finally hear how wonderful of a song this is!
^You’re such a smart grandchild, I don’t know how you young folks know these gadgets.
^Back in my days, there were no “settings” or… umm what do you call it again?
^Speaking of, could you get the internet to work while you’re here?
^Your grandfather mentioned it came from that wee fee device-thingy, somewhere on the left there behind those boxes.
three: ^What’s this now about a password? Your mother set up a new account or whatever, so I have no cooking clue as to what it could be.
^She wrote it down for me but I cannot remember where I put it.
^I bet Dwayne the Rock would know.
four: ^Oooh, so that’s where I placed it! I was right, Dwayne would know.
^He he hee, he knows just what to do. With those dreamy eyes and that little dance, he does with his chest…
^Well, It seems you have the got the wee fee to work, how wonderful of you sweety!
^Perhaps I can finally get the recipe the ladies and I heard about from that show.
^Could you find it for me my dear?
five: ^Oh goodness! What is all of this nonsense!?
^Get rid of it, get rid of them!!!
six: ^Thank goodness, although that free pizza sounded tempting…
^Anyways, now, hmmm… what are all these crosses at the top? And all these things open?
^I just want the brownie recipe page thingy.
seven: ^You are just amazing at these gadgets and thing a ma bobs!
^This is something you are studying right? You must be top of the class!
eight: ^An email account? Oh, just make it anything…
ten: ^Your mother?? My daughter?? You don’t know her?
eleven: ^That was rather pointless, I already know I’m not a robot!
^I am granny! Just for this recipe? Absolute nonsense, honestly…
^That took way too long. Could you be a dear and print this for me?
^I hate looking at the screen for too long, it’s too blurry and bright for your granny.
printing: ^Oh, don’t mind that noise, I just give it a bit of a whack when it makes too many noises.
^In the past when your grandfather printed me a few... uuhhhh... decorative items…
shrine: ^You should not worry about that dear, it’s nothing that umm you are old enough to know…
fourteen: ^Thank you, my dear, this is perfect.
^I should order these ingredients and… herbs the next time I get groceries.
^Would you bother to help a little longer?
^Send this to her with the email?
^I usually call your mom for help but rolls her eyes when I ask nowadays.
^That child needs to be in control of her sassy-ness, honestly.
fifteen: ^A countdown? Too many? Ugh not this again!
